file_content.text: Damned idiotic nerf-herding sons of Hutts!
They got away!
We got what we came for, now let's go.
Hurry up.
They were killed, and possibly eaten. There's a difference.
Not exactly.
What? It don't bother you--these idiots run off with your artifact and you don't even get to knock them around?
I just can't figure you Sith.
That's the way I like it.
Good.
Mysterious, huh. Okay. Suit yourself.
It's enough to know that they suffered.
They got what they had coming.
For you maybe. I was looking forward to shooting the eyeballs out of their skulls.
But you're the boss, huh, Sith?
Not everyone is obsessed with revenge.
You're a sick man.
That's an awful superior thing to say, for a Sith. I saw how you guys operate in Imperial prison.
Snap out of it.
Calm down. [Shock.]
Yeearrgh!
Next time, just slap me in the face, okay? Damn crazy Sith.
What did you call me?
Excuse me?
A damn crazy Sith. Not surprised, though. I saw how you guys work in Imperial prison.
Take your blasters and let's go.
I didn't hear that.
Sure. There's just one thing I want to ask--you got room for an extra hand on your ship?
I tend to get carried away.
Sorry.
Sure you do. I know how you Sith work.
A Sith torturer with a collection of prisoners' fingernails gets zapped because Darth so-and-so doesn't like how he looks.
Sickest monsters in the galaxy, the Sith.
You've overstepped your bounds.
That's not your place.
Not all Sith are that way.
Some of us are different.
It didn't bother you to torture Wilkes when he was already half-dead and raving mad.
You zapped that dancer in the cantina without much thought.
You zapped old Regg the bartender without much thought.
You zapped me!
Look, I like you well enough. I mean, I wouldn't call us friends, but I think we work well together.
Hey, I'm willing to be proven wrong, but it'll take more than talk.
'Cause in my experience, most talk is lies.
You've said too much, fool.
Shut up now.
All right. No need to get angry. I'm just calling it like I see it.
Watch me and see if I'm different or not.
That sounds like a challenge.
Look, I'll make you a deal. Take me with you when you leave this rock.
I'm a pretty good pilot, I've got contacts out there, and I can see if you're really any different from the rest of them.
I can agree to that.
Deal.
Good.
I think you'll be pleasantly surprised.
You'll like what you see.
We'll see, won't we?
But remember, I'm the Sith here. I'm in charge.
Fine.
Promising start.
Now let's get off this rock. I was happy enough to stay here while Wilkes needed killing, but now I'm sick to death of it.
Now you've gone too far.
Enough! [Shock.]
Yeeearrrgh!
Fine, look, I'm sorry. Forget I ever said anything.
If it disgusts you, why did you work with me?
You should've thought of that.
That's my business, ain't it?
Let's just forget I said anything, huh.
I'm sorry, were you talking earlier?
Already forgotten.
Good.
You won't get off that easily.
I never forget.
Then I'll be sure to watch my back.
Next time, I'll rip your tongue out.
This is your only warning.
Then there won't be a next time.
Now are we gonna get off this rock or what?
I still have business to finish here.
Soon.
Well, when you do fly, mind taking me along?
The sooner, the better.
I can't wait.
You mind taking me along for the ride?
You shouldn't presume, pirate.
We?
Look, I gather you don't think much of me, but that don't make me useless.
I'm a damn good pilot, and I've got contacts a Sith'll never make on his own. It'll be your show, no questions asked.
You have no intention of letting this drop, do you?
If you insist.
Well, then let's get off this rock, huh.
I'm in charge, and don't you dare forget it.
On one condition.
Let's just get going.
Come on.
I'll take that as a "yes" then.
I'm going to blast Wilkes to pieces, just as soon as we find him.
"Out of ether's view," huh? Spineless son of a Hutt is hiding underground.
Wilkes is a dead man.
What are we waiting for?
How do you get that from "out of ether's view"?
What?
Ether's what we called out there, space. Can't see space from underground, so space can't see you.
Wilkes and I used to hide hot goods "out of ether's view." Figures he'd hide there.
Smart place to hide.
Makes sense.
I should've thought of it myself.
There's a system of caves on the other side of the abandoned farm settlement. I wager that's what Casey meant.
The sooner I get this done, the better.
All right, I'm going.
Just hold on one moment. I'm going with you.
You've outlived your usefulness.
No.
I don't need you anymore.
Sorry, Andronikos.
Huh. Well, it so happens Casey's looking out for me.
She encrypted the entry code to Wilkes's base on this datapad. You don't know how to decrypt it, but I do.
I've chased him too far to let someone else kill him.
Just don't touch my artifact.
On one condition.
The artifact's yours. It's brought me enough bad luck already.
Revenge is revenge, I guess.
All right, fine.
Thanks.
I'll take you, but just for this one thing.
If you insist.
I'll try not to overstay my welcome.
When I said "I," I meant you, too.
Of course.
Sure you did.
How do we get there?
What's the way?
Looks like she put something else on this datapad. I think I can crack it.
Why aren't you shooting already?
Let's get moving.
Hey, I always want to shoot something. But the old girl encrypted something on this datapad.
It looks like it's an access code. Something we'll need to get into this hidden HQ, probably.
Looks like it could come in handy.
Bring it along.
I'm running out of patience here.
Can we go now?
Between your blaster and my lightning, none will survive!
This is going to be fun.
If you like it that way.
I'm going to blast Wilkes for every day I spent floating in that escape pod. And then I'm going to stomp on his bones.
Tell Regg I can't have any more slipups. Wilkes finds out I'm here, it'll be like Ruusan all over again.
Y--yes, Andronikos. Whatever you say.
Go!
'Bout time, Sith. This room's feelin' a lot like that escape pod.
Make me happy. Tell me you found Wilkes.
Casey said Wilkes was "out of ether's view."
She gave me a cryptic message.
Casey gave me this datapad.
Take a look.
Good girl, Casey. Good girl. She's bailed me out of more than a few messes.
Wilkes is hiding--"out of something's view."
I'm not sure.
Here, let me just have a look at that datapad. Go figure, a Sith with a memory like a gizka.
Find Casey in Exchange territory, and get her to tell us where Wilkes is.
Contact's name is Casey Rix. Old friend who used to be part of my crew. But she, uh, doesn't exactly know I'm here.
She's sure to know where Wilkes is hiding. Tell her you know me, and she'll tell you everything.
I don't care if she's a friend of yours, if she doesn't give me what I want....
She'd better.
Don't worry about it. Casey's good people.
I'll do it.
You must have quite a way with the ladies to produce that kind of reaction.
Everything, hm?
Let's just say that Casey and me go way back.
You get that information, you can do what you want with it, but I'd appreciate if you came back here first.
Me and Wilkes are long overdue for a talk.
Andronikos Revel? I believe you have the artifact I'm looking for.
Webb, folks aren't supposed to know I'm here.
I'm sorry, Andronikos. It was that damn waitress.
I'm sorry, Andronikos. It was that damn bartender.
Take care of it.
Now Sith, your artifact. I don't have it, and I'm glad. Thing drove my crew insane; they mutinied.
I floated ten days in a disabled escape pod and spent thirty more in Imperial lockup on account of that hunk of rock.
I'm only interested in the artifact.
Skip the story.
And I couldn't care less about it, but maybe we can help each other out.
Convenient excuse for failure.
The artifact did it?
Those artifacts belonged to my master, little Sith. Do not underestimate what they can do.
I know what I saw, Sith. But I won't stop you from going after that rock if you want it.
Maybe next time you won't be so quick to steal from Sith.
Serves you right.
Maybe you Sith oughta keep those things someplace safe. But maybe we can help each other out.
The guy who has your artifact is the guy I'm on Tatooine to kill--Sylas Wilkes.
My old first mate. He started the mutiny, then tossed me into space. Now he's an Exchange big shot. He's got your Sith toy.
Why haven't you killed this Wilkes yet? You don't have a reputation for mercy.
He's still alive?
Perhaps a partnership is in order.
We should work together.
Glad you see it that way. It'll take both of us to get to Wilkes.
And what if I don't want to work with you?
Why should I help you?
I know how to get to Wilkes, and I ain't asking much-- just a clear shot, right between the eyes.
If you think you can get a better offer elsewhere, be my guest.
Tell me what you know about the artifact, and we'll see.
Give me the details.
What's your plan?
Just don't start thinking yourself indispensable.
You're useful, for now.
I know what I am, Sith. I won't be in your way.
I've been chasing Wilkes halfway across the galaxy. Stole my favorite blasters, not to mention my pride.
Lucky thing, I got a contact inside the Exchange. Only I can't exactly just stroll into the Exchange base.
Andronikos Revel has his own personal spy network?
Who is this contact?
It ain't quite like that.
The Exchange doesn't scare me.
Let me handle it.
They don't scare me either, only I can't shoot lightning from my fingertips.
Aw, the big bad pirate is afraid of a few little Exchange thugs.
What's the matter? Scared?
Funny, Sith. But some of us can't shoot lightning from our fingertips.
You got no business being here, so I suggest you get out.
So this is the deep desert, huh. Reminds me of a spice mine we raided on Kessel.
Some genius blew open one of the storage areas, and suddenly we were drowning in crystallized spice.
I'm guessing that isn't one of your fonder memories.
That's disgusting.
Anything that don't kill me....
What about the guy who blew open the storage?
And the genius?
Buried alive under a pile of spice. Served him right, I say.
What's this have to do with the desert?
What a stupid story.
Just thinking what it would be like to get buried under all that sand.
According to Wilkes's info, the thieves headed this way. I'll follow your lead.
Stay sharp, Sith. The thieves ran right into the beast's mouth--the Sand People camps.
The Sand People don't give a damn if you're a moisture farmer or the most powerful being in the galaxy.
They'll kill you, serve you up raw and give your bones to their Sand People babies to gnaw on.
Don't tell me you're intimidated.
Scared?
I've dealt with far worse.
Not if I gnaw on them, first.
Unlikely.
Just telling you what to expect.
I suggest we do our best to prevent that.
Let's not let them.
Next you'll suggest we find a way to make the Sand People dead.
The key is to keep moving, and hope no one catches us from behind before we've got the goods.
I hope you're on your game, Sith. Because we can't afford slipups, and I can't drag you out if you die.
The sooner we get this done, the better.
Let's go.
What are you suggesting, pirate?
Watch yourself.
Hey, just a little joke. Save the anger for the Sand People, huh.
Now let's go.
You just worry about yourself.
I won't die.
All right, then. Let's go.
According to this datapad, the thieves headed in this direction.
According to Wilkes's info, the thieves went out that way.
This datapad says the thieves went this way. They can't be much further.
Come on, we're losing time. We gotta go to the deep desert--before those thieves get away.
I'm going to kill those thieves, but not before I break all their bones.
Stay sharp, Sith. The thieves ran right into the beast's mouth--the Sand People camps.
Let's get off this rock.
My master, what is this? Would you abandon Khem Val, servant of the great Tulak Hord, for some weak human?
It's nothing personal Khem, but Andronikos is cuter.
Sorry.
I do what I do for power.
Sorry.
I need him to find the artifact.
This is temporary.
Be wary. I will not be easily forgotten.
I've had enough of your complaining, monster.
Shut up.
I am no monster. I am Khem Val, and I will not suffer long in silence.
The bond between us is strong, but it can be broken.
I promise this is only for a short time.
Patience, Khem.
I count on you to keep that promise, master. I will wait at the ship.
Do not underestimate my strength. It is growing daily.
In the meantime, I will wait for you at the ship.
I'm sorry, Khem. We just weren't meant to be.
Breaking up is so hard.
I will be waiting at the ship, then, master.
Wonderful.
